results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
This film shows the Drayton Family on a road trip holiday across Tasmania to visit Hobart and the Port Arthur Penitentiary. There are numerous views of the scenery and the sea.

The film shows the Port Arthur Prison, Police Station, Asylum, church and the St David’s Anglican Church.

The film also includes Hobart’s double decker trams and zoo with an Emu, Polar Bear, Brown Bear and Barbary Macaque.

A slice of history showing a DC-2 VH-UXJ Loongana plane which was used by the Australian National Airways initially to service a twice weekly trip between Melbourne and Perth. It began in 1936 and was withdrawn in 1947.

Two bridges are shown. The Scamander Bridge and the McGee Bridge, Hobart.

A number of scenes with Navy Ships in them including Sailors painting one.

Two interesting shots are a car which has fallen down a bank and a stone fence with sharp pointed stones on top.

1940s Fashion is clearly seen in the film with numerous shots of family members throughout.

Also shown is the John Hart Conservatory in Launceston.

The film ends with scenes of the family members at home with their pets, a dog and two cats. Also, a kid’s tricycle and Mr Drayton driving an old vintage car.

Original made using standard 16mm film and titled

Tasmania holiday. Home/family. Dad in car.

SELECTED HIGHLIGHTS:
00:00:56:00 – Mr Drayton (father) and policeman

00:01:08:00 – Double decker trams – Hobart

00:01:01:00 – Mrs Drayton (mother) and Roy (brother)

00:02:02:00 – Sailors painting ship

00:02:21:00 – Port Arthur Penitentiary

00:02:58:00 – Drayton family members in front of Port Arthur Police Station

00:03:08:00 – Drayton family in front of Port Arthur Asylum

00:03:25:00 – Albert Drayton

00:03:40:00 – Port Arthur prison building.

00:03:56:00 – Port Arthur Church

00:04:18:00 – St David’s Anglican Church

00:04:34:00 – DC-2 VH-UXJ Loongana plane – Australian National Airways

00:05:26:00 – John Hart Conservatory, Launceston

00:06:25:00 – Child on vintage tricycle with cat and dog.

00:06:36:00 – Albert Drayton drives a two-seater Singer (possibly a Nine, Nine Sports or Le Mans), manufactured circa 1934-1938

results.title: [Remix: Summer beaches and pools]
results.brief_description: This remix of films from the ACMI Collection features footage of people sunbathing, playing at beaches during warm summers in Victoria. Notably, people are seen lounging around and diving into the Beaurepaire Pool, Melbourne’s first 50-metre Olympic-size swimming pool, formerly located on Batman Avenue.

results.title: [Remix: Victorian Road Signs]
results.brief_description:
Produced using footage from the ACMI Collection, this remix features painted road signs from locations all over Victoria, interspliced with shots of native wildlife and natural wilderness.

Road signs in order of appearance are: Halls Gap, Horsham, McKenzie Falls, Murray Valley Highway, Corryon, Walwa, Tumbarumba, Jingellic, Upper Kiewa Valley Road, Mt Beauty, Rocky Valley, Princes Highway, Gembrook, Cockatoo, Whitfield, Wangaratta, Ferntree Gully, Wilson’s Promontory National Park, Ovens River, Beechworth, San Remo, Porepunkah, Murray River, Anglesea and Great Ocean Road.

results.title: Living with happiness
results.creator_credit: Sarah Watt Productions and Sarah Watt
results.brief_description: A young mother finds herself gripped by an overwhelming pessimism that threatens to consume her. Only a freak accident on a lonely beach may be the key to her future happiness. Voices performed by Sigrid Thornton and William McInnes. (Awards: Winner, Emirates AFI Award for Best Animation, 2001)

results.title: Sidney Nolan
results.brief_description: Sidney Nolan’s interest in and pre-occupation with Australian history and legend have earned him the affectionate title “The Songman of his tribe”. Nolan’s imaginative and poetic vision is revealed in some 150 paintings. His earliest works and his series on Ned Kelly, Mrs Frazer, Bourke and Wills, the Australian outback, Eureka Stockade, Leda and the swan, and Gallipoli, give a rare insight into the mind and stature of this artist. Also shows the artist at work in his studio.

results.title: Holiday album
results.creator_credit: Herschells Films and Roy A. Driver
results.brief_description: Snapshots from a family holiday album show tourist attractions throughout Victoria: recreation in the metropolitan area; winter sports at Mt Buffalo; springtime in the Grampians; a leisurely journey down the Murray in the paddle-steamer “Coonawarra”; sailing and fishing at Lakes Entrance; forest country at Marysville; the beaches along the Great Ocean Road. Commentary by Robert Peach.

results.title: Begonia festival
results.creator_credit: Boolari Films, State Film Centre of Victoria and David Corke
results.brief_description: At the annual Begonia Festival, Ballarat becomes a city of flowers, music, dancing and drama centred on the famous begonia display. Mr. Tom Beaumont, the curator of the glass house in the Botanic Gardens, tends the many blooms. He is a world authority on begonia culture. Highlights of the display are a thousand double blooms and six hundred distinctive single varieties. In the gardens we see a fine display of salvias, gladioli and dahlias. Young and old admire the wonderful colour and variety of the Botanic Gardens and also the open air art exhibition. Commentary by John Morgan.

results.title: Fifty fifty
results.creator_credit: Face Value Productions and Carole Sklan
results.brief_description: Flashing back and forth between the Fifties and the Eighties, the film explores with wit and panache the political and social connections between the two eras, converting a potential nostalgia trip into a sharply focused but entertaining analysis of the pressure placed on men and women then and now.

results.title: Eat, drink and be wary
results.brief_description: This film examines some of the problems associated with modern man’s increased reliance on manufactured and processed foods. Discusses the issues of additives, food processing, and the changes taking place in the American diet

results.title: Home on the range: U.S. bases in Australia
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission and Gil Scrine
results.brief_description: Examines the existence of U.S. military bases in Australia and how their presence has affected its position in the nuclear arms race between the Soviet Union and America. Considers the question of nuclear arms in Australia in terms of the presence of the C.I.A. in Australia, its manipulation on the course of Australia’s political affairs and the mounting opposition by the general public. Script: Gil Scrine, Bob Connolly, David Bradbury Narrated by Annie Webster, David Ritchie
